instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: It is small water damage in the <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> area.  <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> was missing i put another cap im getting <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> also <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is present and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v  i think all signals are present for the computer to get green light bu i don't have green light. At some point while <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> was missing i got green light but board wouldn't turn on after i put the <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> i lost the green light also the Voltage that im getting is 7.3V that's <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_BOOST</SIGNAL>, also the via for <SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_BOOST</SIGNAL> was damaged from pin 3 of  <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>  to pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR>. Any ideas???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
1) If the via from pin 3 of <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> to pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> was damaged, I hope to god you fixed it before posting this. If something is broken, FIX IT!!! If it isn't fixed, do not pass go, you know what to do..

2) How shitty do pins 1, 19, and 21 look on J9500?

3) How shitty does the flex cable between the dc in board and the logic board look?

4) Have you tried a known working DC in board & known good 821-1722 flex cable?


Look at what <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> look like on any <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> from 2010-present or any <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> from 2010 to the present... now look at the air dc in board. Notice how it uses the same onewire circuit? You can measure on the dc in board and see if <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> are making their way over to the dc in board like they should be.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: All areas on the board are super clean just around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>, so i just plug the same charger to my 15 inch macbook pro retina display and when i got green light i plug back to the board im working on and i get also green light but computer doesn't power if i plug the charger in my retina macbook and get orange light when i plug back to the air is stays orange but no fan spin

threads.message: I have light on the charger now I'll continue troubleshooting why i don't have fan spin

threads.message: This is cheating, you should have light on the charger just plugging it into the air! Answer my questions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is missing i check <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> i have voltage only on Pin 23 VIN that's <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> and pin 22 <SIGNAL>P5VP3V3_VREG3</SIGNAL> the enable signals on pins 12, 21 and 4 they are all missing and that leads me to the SMC am I right ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Pins 1, 19 and 21 are perfect 
i have 3 flex cable between the dc in board and the logic board known to work 
i've tried a known working DC in board & known good 821-1722 flex cable
Thanks for the advice to compare the 1278 boards makes a lot of sense if you watch the old schematics

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is required for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and this does come from the SMC.

You still haven't answered my questions from my first post in this thread. I can't help you if you can't answer me. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> ripple can kill the SMC but I am not jumping to this conclusion based on not having any information. Give me the information I asked for!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
the damaged via is fixed that's the first thing i did 
Pins 1, 19 and 21 are perfect 
i have 3 flex cable between the dc in board and the logic board known to work 
i've tried a known working DC in board & known good 821-1722 flex cable
Thanks for the advice to compare the 1278 boards makes a lot of sense if you watch the old schematics

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is missing. You think smc reflow would solve the problem ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO Green light MacBook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I removed the filling around the SMC and i reflow the SMC that solve my problem thank you for your help Louis i appritiate it .
